response.answer_text: Well… Importance of science and technology: With the science and technology the life became easy.The role that science and technology has played in improving the life conditions across the globe is vivid, but the benefit has to been harvested maximum by all countries. Science and technology has made life a lot easier and also a lot better with the advancement of medicines and analysis on diseases. Technology, science and knowledge are important in modern contemporary society. Essential questions include the following: How does science and technology produce new products, new ways of understanding, new ways of living and new institutions? Why is new technology and knowledge so fundamental to us in the ways through which we imagine the future? Technology, knowledge and science are fundamental in modern contemporary society. The understanding of how social, cultural and material elements influence the production of new practices, new ways of understanding and new institutions is vital in our understanding of contemporary postmodern society. Studies of technology and science provides students with insight into how different processes of knowledge are initiated and progressed, and how innovative technological processes are developed, employed and increase in importance. Studies of technology and science gives insight into the understanding and knowledge of technology, science and knowledge from the viewpoint of the humanities and the social sciences. Throughout the course of study students will become familiar with amendments of social and cultural analyses of modern science and technology in interaction with social, political, economical and cultural processes of change. In this manner, students will be provided with the academic basis for working with detailed analyses of different forms of technologies and processes of knowledge, within business life/industry and commerce, research and research-related work, political development, management of knowledge and innovation.

They’re important because they keep us inter-connected and they streamline the processing and manufacturing of goods and services. Without technology, we would not have access to limitless amounts of information and knowledge that sources like the internet provide us. We would not be able to easily communicate with people across the world in seconds, and we would be unable to process international transactions on a wide-scale. Technology strives towards the globalization of our world. Without it, we would be more isolated and localized as a society. Science is the foundation upon which technology relies upon, and upon what our universe relies upon. Without Biology, our bodies wouldn’t have evolved to create the multi-cell organisms we are today. Without Chemistry, we would be unable to find cures for diseases and medicine to help treat people with life-threatening diseases. Without Physics, nothing would exist, as it literally governs the laws of our universe. So to answer it bluntly, they are very important. Without them, our world as we know it, wouldn’t exist.

How important they are depends on what you consider to be important. “Important” is subjective - what’s important to one person isn’t necessarily to the next. So, let’s consider some questions that will help you gauge how important *you* think science and technology are. The more of these you answer “yes”, the more important you think science and technology are! Do you like your cell phone?Do you like video games?Do you like getting to see more of the world than that of a moderately sized state in a lifetime?Do you like getting to see more of the world, without having to ride on an animal?Do you like food you didn’t have to hunt?Do you like getting to eat more than about a dozen kinds of food in your life?Do you like your food cooked?Do you like knowing your food was cooked properly?Do you like knowing you won’t get attacked by a wild animal during the night?Do you like knowing you probably won’t get attacked by a wild animal while you’re out & about during the day?Do you like light other than the sun?Do you like not dying, or having loved ones die, commonly at a very young age and for often unknown reasons?Do you like having a place for your poo to go, and it going away where you don’t have to think about it or do anything with it?Do you like entertainment that doesn’t involve creative uses of a stick and/or rock?There are many more questions of course, but I think this gives an idea…

With science and technology, new innovations are being introduced in the world, that are making the various process of our lives easier. With gadgets and tools being created with the help of scientific and technological research we now can perform certain tasks without effort as compared to the past. Science and technology have also helped in the betterment and advancement of healthcare services. With the latest technologies, difficult operations can now be performed in less time and effectively. Moreover, scientific research helps in the analysis of new emerging diseases and in the creation of their remedies. The latest example we can take is of the COVID-19 pandemic, where scientific research has helped the world to overcome this deadly virus and technology has helped save countless lives.

You must first consider life to be important. Or rather, the continuation of life. Assuming you look forward to having more life, then you also care about science and technology. In 2015, almost 500,000 people died of malaria. Science will be the thing that makes it so half a million don’t die every year moving forward. If a massive asteroid hits Earth, the human race could quite possibly go extinct. If science and technology progress, humans will live on other planets so that the whole species would not be wiped out, or we’ll be able to divert the asteroid in the first place! In a nutshell, science and technology, in many many ways not named here, enable us to not die.

Let’s take an example - in the 1920s some folks dealt with an esoteric branch if Physics called Quantum Mechanics … that’s Science … leaping through a few interim technological stages, you are able to punch away Q&A in Quora today. So, from Q to Q (Quantum-Mechanics -> Quora) Here are the interim stages: Quantum Mechanics -> Solid State Physics -> Transistor -> Integrated Circuits (Millions of Transistors on a piece of Silicon) -> Computers -> Networks -> Internet → Quora. Well - is that “important”? Without pegging it as good or bad, it clearly has a large impact on the way we function as a society - so I call that “important”
